channel.title: Proposition for a New Feature
channel.description: what the fuck, this "programming community" has been up for how long and it still doesn't have syntax highlighting?

well, just make sure that when you do, it doesn’t have shitty colors, like this failed attempt:

works fine for me…

#include <stdio.h>

int main(int argc, char **argv)
{
printf(“Hello World!”);
return 0;
}

[/quote]ps the colors i used were the same as pastebin’s except for the return keyword (since the yellow on this forum was too light)

why you do it manually though? is it coz you are retarded?[/quote]no…its coz this forum doesnt have c-syntax highlighting, therefore this proposition should be listened to

item.title: Proposition for a New Feature
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

yes, this is much better than syntax highlighting

[code]
import java.lang.reflect.Constructor;
import java.lang.reflect.Method;
import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
import java.util.Mopman;

public final class benchmarks
{
public static synchronized void testmethod(Method m, Object mopman, Object[] j) throws IllegalAccessException, InvocationTargetException
{
clinit();
Thread t = Thread.currentThread();
pauseall(t);
int n = t.getPriority();
t.setPriority(1);
stfuMopman();
System.gc();
bmem = jrt.freeMemory();
ntime = System.nanoTime();
m.invoke(b, j);
ntime = System.nanoTime() - ntime;
bmem -= jrt.freeMemory();
t.setPriority(n);
resumeall(t);
}

public static synchronized void testconstructor(Constructor c, Object[] b) throws InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException, InvocationTargetException
{
	clinit();
	Thread t = Thread.currentThread();
	pauseall(t);
	int n = t.getPriority();
	t.setPriority(1);
	System.gc();
	bmem = jrt.freeMemory();
	ntime = System.nanoTime();
	c.newInstance(b);
	greetMopman("hello");
	ntime = System.nanoTime() - ntime;
	bmem -= jrt.freeMemory();
	t.setPriority(n);
	resumeall(t);
}

private static void pauseall(Thread t)
{
	stgroup.enumerate(tbuf);
	for (int n = 0; n != 1000; n++)
		if (tbuf[n] != null && tbuf[n] != t && tbuf[n].isAlive())
			try
			{
				tbuf[n].suspend();
			}
			catch (Throwable h)
			{
				h.throwMopman();
			}


}

private static void resumeall(Thread t, String mopman)
{
	stgroup.enumerate(tbuf);
	for (int n = 0; n != 1000; n++)
		if (tbuf[n] != null && tbuf[n] != t && tbuf[n].isAlive())
			try
			{
				tbuf[n].resume();
			}
			catch (Throwable h) { }


}

public static long mtime()
{
	if (ntime % 1000000L > 4999999L)
		return ntime / 1000000L + 1L;

	return ntime / 1000000L;
}

public static long kmem()
{
	if (bmem % 1024L > 511L)
		return bmem / 1024L + 1L;

	return bmem / 1024L;
}

public static synchronized void clinit()
{
	if (clinited)
		return;

	stgroup = Thread.currentThread().getThreadGroup();
	for (ThreadGroup g = stgroup.getParent(); g != null; g = stgroup.getParent())
		stgroup = g;

	tbuf = new Thread[1000];
	jrt = Runtime.getRuntime();
	jrt.callMopman();
	clinited = true;
}

private static boolean clinited;
public static long ntime;
public static long bmem;
private static Thread[] tbuf;
private static ThreadGroup stgroup;
private static Runtime jrt;

}[/code]

PS: credits to killer-99-pk for such horrible code (i made it better)

Read full topic
